thread.title: Moto G5 and G5 Plus leaked in case renders, feature all-metal design and fingerprint sensors
thread.title_full: Moto G5 and G5 Plus leaked in case renders, feature all-metal design and fingerprint sensors

title: Moto G5 and G5 Plus leaked in case renders, feature all-metal design and fingerprint sensors
text:
Moto G5 and G5 Plus leaked in case renders, feature all-metal design... Moto G5 and G5 Plus leaked in case renders, feature all-metal design and fingerprint sensors By January 27, 2017 “The Moto G5 and G5 Plus will feature premium designs and fingerprint sensors” 
We have already seen a couple of live images and a press render of the upcoming Moto G5 Plus smartphone. Now a case maker in China has released several photos of the Moto G5 and Moto G5 Plus, which are based on the preliminary renders from Lenovo. The renders suggest that the Moto G5 and G5 Plus will offer a similar design. Here’s how one case maker thinks the Motorola G5 will look. Seems based on preliminary renders from Lenovo/Moto (2/2) pic.twitter.com/cXwsTolJj6 — Roland Quandt (@rquandt) January 26, 2017 
As seen in the photos, the Moto G5 and G5 Plus will offer a premium metal unibody design. The phones will have a physical home button, which is expected to hide a fingerprint sensor beneath. They appear to have a large camera module on the back with a dual-LED flash. Unfortunately, the tipster hasn’t revealed any other details about the upcoming Moto G series phones. Here’s how one case maker thinks the Motorola Moto G5 Plus will look. Seems based on preliminary renders from Lenovo/Moto (1/2) pic.twitter.com/gKAUojiARW — Roland Quandt (@rquandt) January 26, 2017 
As per the earlier reports, the Moto G5 Plus will feature a 5.5-inch full HD display, and will boot Android 7.0 Nougat. It will feature a 2GHz octa-core Snapdragon 625 SoC, mated to 4GB of RAM. It will come with 32GB of expandable storage, a 12MP rear snapper, a 5MP front shooter, 4G LTE, dual-band Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.1 and a 3,100mAh battery. The Moto G5 is expected to feature a smaller display. 
The Moto G5 and G5 Plus are expected to be unveiled at Lenovo’s February 26th pre-MWC event in Barcelona. The rumour mill suggests that soon after the unveiling, they will be launched in India in March. Facebook Comments
